Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Biological Response Modifier/Immunostimulant/GM-CSF-Encoding Oncolytic Herpes Simplex Virus,/NCIThesaurus/Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Biological Agent/Oncolytic Virus/GM-CSF-Encoding Oncolytic Herpes Simplex Virus
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: An oncolytic, recombinant herpes simplex type-1 virus (HSV) encoding human cytokine granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor (GM-CSF) with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Upon administration, GM-CSF-encoding oncolytic HSV selectively infects and replicates in tumor cells, thereby inducing tumor cell lysis. In addition, expressed GM-CSF may stimulate a cytotoxic T cell response against tumor cells, resulting in immune-mediated tumor cell death in addition to HSV-mediated oncolytic tumor cell death.
